page.title: 17Wild Birds at Aston Clinton
page.content: Waterbirds come round this area because there are many types of canals and reservoirs. Moorhens and Ducks, mostly Mallard, are very common. Swans are fewer because the water is not very clear and they often die because of fishing tackle left around. Geese are quite popular and can be found mainly in reservoirs. Tawny owls are very rarely seen in the day because they are nocturnal. They obtain voles from the water, but they are shy. Wrens live in hedgerows with ivy. They are very timid. Kingfishers are seen around here and love the fish in the reservoirs. Swallows fly over canals so fast you could think they would crash! Great Crested Grebes also can be seen in the area.
